p: In 2018, the United Nations Secretary General launched the ‘Financing the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development’ ( 29) strategy. This strategy highlights key actions to enable countries to finance the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)( 30). SDG funding pools, such as those for reducing maternal and child mortality, could be used to finance hepatitis B elimination activities where they facilitate SDG achievement(30). Investment in viral hepatitis elimination activities should be integrated into universal health coverage (UHC, a target of SDG 3) to maximize service access and efficiencies in resource use in health systems, and reduce direct costs of care to individuals, thus minimizing catastrophic health costs for the population(31, 32).
